When segmenting customers, include physician-owned offices and investment-backed small businesses as potential buyers of infrastructure services.

items.title: How I Built A $1M/Year Business - And Helped My Parents Retire

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Tuan Le emigrated from Vietnam to Toronto and vowed at 15 to help his parents retire. Ten years later his social video production company, ShortsCut, brings in over $1 million USD a year in sales, and he now pays his parents' rent and living expenses so they no longer have to work full time.
bullets: Tuan Le promised at 15 to help his parents after the family moved to Toronto.
He founded ShortsCut, a social video production company.
ShortsCut generates more than $1 million USD annually in sales.
Tuan now covers his parents' rent and living expenses, enabling their retirement.
Video produced by CNBC Make It; transcript not available.
takeaways: High-revenue social video businesses (e.g., ShortsCut) represent a commercial segment that can drive demand for digital delivery and storage services.
Sustained content production at scale often requires reliable infrastructure for hosting, distribution, and backup.
Successful independent studios can become long-term, paying customers for cloud, CDN, and edge-capacity solutions.

items.title: New CO2 Battery Stores 8 Hours of Energy

Stores 20 megawatts of power
Provides roughly 8 hours of energy storage

takeaways: 20 MW / 8-hour capacity targets medium-duration storage needs for grids and large facilities
